model2.Parameters: n_estimators, maximum depth (tuned via cross-validation), initial_strategy="KNNimputer"
model2.Model Description: A random forest is a meta estimator that fits a number of classifying decision trees on various sub-samples of the dataset. Run on a year-by-year basis
model2.Model Advantage: uses averaging to improve the predictive accuracy and control over-fitting via bootsrapping

Model 3.Parameters: loss_function, learning_rate, n_estimators, maximum depth (tuned via cross-validation), initial_strategy="KNNimputer"
Model 3.Model Description: builds an additive model in a forward stage-wise fashion. In each stage a regression tree is fit on the negative gradient of the given loss function. Run on a year-by-year basis
Model 3.Model Drawback: Overfitting especially when there is noisy data
